get_previous_pipeline_step(idx=0, of_type=None)[source]¶

Retrieve one of the previously applied PipelineSteps, either by index or by type.

Parameters:

  • idx (int, optional) – List index used if of_type is None. Defaults to 0, which is the PipeLine step most recently applied.

  • of_type (PipelineStep, optional) – Return the most recently applied PipelineStep of this type.

Return type:

PipelineStep

index_levels¶

Keeps track of index level names. Also used for automatic naming of output files.

indices: List[ID]¶

List of indices (IDs) which serve for accessing individual pieces of data and associated metadata. An index is a (‘corpus_name’, ‘piece_name’) tuple (“ID”) that can have a third element identifying a segment/chunk of a piece.

property n_indices¶
pieces: Dict[ID, ms3.Piece]¶

{(corpus, fname) -> Any} References to the individual pieces contained in the data. The exact type depends on the type of data.

pipeline_steps¶

The sequence of applied PipelineSteps that has led to the current state in reverse order (first element was applied last).

new_indices – The new list IDs or a dictionary of several lists of IDs. The latter is useful for re-grouping freshly sliced IDs of a GroupedDataset.

class dimcat.data.base.GroupedData(data: Data, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: _ProcessedData

A type of Data object that behaves like its predecessor but returns and iterates through groups.

grouped_indices: Dict[GroupID, List[ID]]¶

{group_key -> indices} dictionary of indices (IDs) which serve for accessing individual pieces of data and associated metadata. An index is a (‘corpus_name’, ‘piece_name’) tuple (“ID”) that can have a third element identifying a segment/chunk of a piece. The group_keys are an empty tuple by default; with every applied Grouper, the length of all group_keys grows by one and the number of group_keys grows or stays the same.

iter_grouped_indices() → Iterator[Tuple[str, List[Union[PieceID, Tuple[str, str, Interval]]]]][source]¶

Iterate through groups of indices as defined by the previously applied Groupers.

Yields:

  • tuple of str – A tuple of keys reflecting the group hierarchy

  • list of tuple – A list of IDs belonging to the same group.

iter_grouped_slice_info() → Iterator[Tuple[tuple, DataFrame]][source]¶

Iterate through concatenated slice_info DataFrame for each group.

type_mapping: Dict[Union[str, Collection[str]], str] = {('AnalyzedGroupedSlicedDataset', 'AnalyzedSlicedDataset'): 'AnalyzedGroupedSlicedDataset', 'GroupedSlicedDataset': 'GroupedSlicedDataset', ('AnalyzedGroupedDataset', 'AnalyzedDataset'): 'AnalyzedGroupedDataset', 'SlicedDataset': 'GroupedSlicedDataset', 'Dataset': 'GroupedDataset'}¶

{Input type(s) -> Output type}. __new__() picks the first ‘value’ where the input Data are of type ‘key’. Objects raise TypeError if nothing matches. object or Data can be used as fallback/default key.

dimcat.data.base.PROCESSED_DATA_FIELDS: Dict[str, Tuple[str, ...]] = {'AnalyzedData': ('processed',), 'GroupedData': ('grouped_indices',), 'SlicedData': ('sliced', 'slice_info')}¶

Name of the data fields that the three types of processing add to any _Dataset object. Important for copying objects.

class dimcat.data.base.SlicedData(data: Data, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: _ProcessedData

A type of Data object that contains the slicing information created by a Slicer. It slices all requested facets based on that information.

excluded_types: Union[str, Collection[str]] = ['AnalyzedData', 'SlicedData']¶

Objects raise TypeError upon instantiation if the passed data are of one of these types.

get_slice(index, what)[source]¶
get_slice_info() → DataFrame[source]¶

Concatenates slice_info Series and returns them as a DataFrame.

iter_slice_info() → Iterator[Tuple[Tuple[str, str, Interval], Series]][source]¶

Iterate through concatenated slice_info Series for each group.

slice_info¶

Dict holding metadata of slices (e.g. the localkey of a segment).

sliced¶

Dict for sliced data facets.

type_mapping: Dict[Union[str, Collection[str]], str] = {'Dataset': 'SlicedDataset', 'GroupedDataset': 'GroupedSlicedDataset'}¶

{Input type(s) -> Output type}. __new__() picks the first ‘value’ where the input Data are of type ‘key’. Objects raise TypeError if nothing matches. object or Data can be used as fallback/default key.

dimcat.data.base.remove_corpus_from_ids(result)[source]¶

Called when group contains corpus_names and removes redundant repetition from indices.

get_item(ID: Tuple[str, str, Interval], what: Literal['measures', 'notes', 'rests', 'notes_and_rests', 'labels', 'expanded', 'form_labels', 'cadences', 'events', 'chords']) → Optional[DataFrame][source]¶

Retrieve a DataFrame pertaining to the facet what of the piece index. If the facet has been sliced before, the sliced DataFrame is returned.

Parameters:

  • ID – (corpus, fname) or (corpus, fname, interval)

  • what – What facet to retrieve.

Returns:

DataFrame representing an entire score facet, or a chunk (slice) of it.

Parameters:

what (str) – Facet for which to create slices if necessary
